description.narrative: Moldova: Moldova and the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) have signed a five-year, $262 million MCC compact aimed at reducing poverty and accelerating economic growth. The compact focuses on irrigation reconstruction, access to agricultural finance, and the rehabilitation of an integral section of the country's national road network. Moldova is a low income country, the poorest country in Europe. Agriculture has long been the country's economic foundation. Farming accounts for more than 40 percent of employment and 17 percent of the country's gross domestic product. Moldova's agriculture currently suffers from low productivity, contributing to high rates of rural poverty. In addition, the deteriorated quality of Moldova's roads has been cited as a constraint to economic growth, as it raises the costs of internal and external production and trade.

title.narrative: Moldova Compact Monitoring and Evaluation Plan
Moldova Post-Compact Monitoring and Evaluation Plan
Removing Barriers to High-Value Agriculture in Moldova

condition.narrative: 10. Prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, funding for a specific Project and/or Activity, MCA-Moldova shall have duly executed an Implementing Entity Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, with the applicable Implementing Entity involved in the implementation of such Project and/or Activity, and such Implementing Entity Agreement shall be in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission, or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default shall have occurred or be continuing thereunder. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(a))

10a. Road Rehabilitation ProjectPrior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, funding for a specific Project and/or Activity, MCA-Moldova shall have duly executed an Implementing Entity Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, with the applicable Implementing Entity involved in the implementation of such Project and/or Activity, and such Implementing Entity Agreement shall be in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission, or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default shall have occurred or be continuing thereunder. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(a))

10b. Transition to High Value AgriculturePrior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, funding for a specific Project and/or Activity, MCA-Moldova shall have duly executed an Implementing Entity Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, with the applicable Implementing Entity involved in the implementation of such Project and/or Activity, and such Implementing Entity Agreement shall be in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission, or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default shall have occurred or be continuing thereunder. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(a))

10c. Access to Agricultural Finance ActivityPrior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, funding for a specific Project and/or Activity, MCA-Moldova shall have duly executed an Implementing Entity Agreement, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, with the applicable Implementing Entity involved in the implementation of such Project and/or Activity, and such Implementing Entity Agreement shall be in full force and effect without modification, alteration, rescission, or suspension of any kind, unless otherwise agreed by MCC, and no material default shall have occurred or be continuing thereunder. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(a))

11. Prior to any Disbursement of Program Funding for payment, in whole or in part, under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project and/or Activity (or any component or segment thereof, as the case may be), MCA-Moldova will have submitted evidence satisfactory to MCC demonstrating that (i) an environmental review has been completed in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines and Moldovan Ministry of Environment (?ME?) requirements with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be), which environmental review may include an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment, Environmental Assessment, Environmental Management Plan, HIV/AIDS Awareness Plan, and/or Resettlement Framework Policy/Resettlement Action Plan (collectively, the ?Applicable ESA Documentation?), (ii) MCA-Moldova, or the appropriate Government entity, has obtained and MCA-Moldova has on file an original or a copy, as applicable, of all required environmental and other permits, validly issued and in full effect, necessary to perform each Project or Activity, and (iii) MCA-Moldova, or the appropriate Government entity, is in compliance with the requirements of the Applicable ESA Documentation, any ME requirements, and any environmental or other permits with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be) in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(c))

11a. Road Rehabilitation ProjectPrior to any Disbursement of Program Funding for payment, in whole or in part, under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project and/or Activity (or any component or segment thereof, as the case may be), MCA-Moldova will have submitted evidence satisfactory to MCC demonstrating that (i) an environmental review has been completed in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines and Moldovan Ministry of Environment (?ME?) requirements with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be), which environmental review may include an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment, Environmental Assessment, Environmental Management Plan, HIV/AIDS Awareness Plan, and/or Resettlement Framework Policy/Resettlement Action Plan (collectively, the ?Applicable ESA Documentation?), (ii) MCA-Moldova, or the appropriate Government entity, has obtained and MCA-Moldova has on file an original or a copy, as applicable, of all required environmental and other permits, validly issued and in full effect, necessary to perform each Project or Activity, and (iii) MCA-Moldova, or the appropriate Government entity, is in compliance with the requirements of the Applicable ESA Documentation, any ME requirements, and any environmental or other permits with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be) in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(c))

11b. Transition to High Value AgriculturePrior to any Disbursement of Program Funding for payment, in whole or in part, under a particular works or construction contract for a given Project and/or Activity (or any component or segment thereof, as the case may be), MCA-Moldova will have submitted evidence satisfactory to MCC demonstrating that (i) an environmental review has been completed in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines and Moldovan Ministry of Environment (?ME?) requirements with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be), which environmental review may include an Environmental and Social Impact Assessment, Environmental Assessment, Environmental Management Plan, HIV/AIDS Awareness Plan, and/or Resettlement Framework Policy/Resettlement Action Plan (collectively, the ?Applicable ESA Documentation?), (ii) MCA-Moldova, or the appropriate Government entity, has obtained and MCA-Moldova has on file an original or a copy, as applicable, of all required environmental and other permits, validly issued and in full effect, necessary to perform each Project or Activity, and (iii) MCA-Moldova, or the appropriate Government entity, is in compliance with the requirements of the Applicable ESA Documentation, any ME requirements, and any environmental or other permits with respect to such Project and/or Activity (or component or segment thereof, as the case may be) in accordance with the MCC Environmental Guidelines. (PIA Schedule 2, 1(c))

12. Prior to any disbursement of MCC Funding in or for Year 5 of the Compact Term, the Government shall have presented a plan pursuant to which it will assume all of the contractual, financial, and other obligations of MCA-Moldova upon expiration of the Compact Term, including, but not limited to, any severance payments owed to MCA-Moldova?s employees upon the termination or expiration of their respective employment contracts (PIA Schedule 2, 1(d))

1a. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived). The Compact has entered into force as provided in Section 7.3 of the Compact. (PIA 3.4(a))

1b. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived). MCC is satisfied, in its sole discretion, that MCA-Moldova is sufficiently mobilized in order for MCA-Moldova to be able to fully perform its obligations and act on behalf of the Government. For the avoidance of doubt, prior to the initial Disbursement of Program Funding that includes, in whole or in part, funding for a specific Project and/or Activity, MCA-Moldova will have selected and engaged the appropriate Officer(s) necessary for the implementation of such Project and/or Activity. (PIA 3.4(b))

1c. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived). MCA-Moldova has delivered a duly executed certificate substantially in the form provided by MCC, together with the attachments thereto. (PIA 3.4(c))

1d. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived). The Fiscal Agent has delivered a duly executed certificate substantially in the form provided by MCC. (PIA 3.4(d))

1e. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived). MCA-Moldova has developed and adopted a complete Implementation Plan, and the plan has been approved by MCC. (PIA 3.4(e))

1f. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent to the initial disbursement of Program Funding set forth in Section 3.4 of the PIA (or such condition has been deferred or waived). MCA-Moldova has established and adopted a BCS, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, that provides suppliers, contractors, and consultants (interested parties) the ability to seek review of procurement actions and decisions. (PIA 3.4(f), Schedule 2, 1(b))
2. No later than ninety (90) days after Entry into Force, MCA-Moldova will develop, adopt, and implement an M&E Plan, in form and substance satisfactory to MCC. (PIA 2.3)
3a. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Narrative Report
3b. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Disbursement Request
3c. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Quarterly Financial Report
3d. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Detailed Financial Plan
3e. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Procurement Performance Report
3f. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Indicator Tracking Table
3g. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Conditions Precedent Report

3h. Copies of any reports received from any technical (including, without limitation, environmental) auditors engaged by MCA-Moldova for any Project or Activity since the previous Disbursement Request
3i. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): MCA-Moldova Disbursement Certificate
3j. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate
3k. MCA-Moldova has delivered each of the documents set forth in Section 3.5(a) of the PIA, each in form and substance acceptable to MCC. (PIA 3.5(a)): Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate

4a. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. All applicable conditions precedent in Schedule 2 to the PIA have been duly satisfied, deferred, or waived as provided in the PIA (PIA 3.5(b)(i))

4b. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. No material default or breach of any covenant, obligation or responsibility by the Government, MCA-Moldova, or any Government entity has occurred and is continuing under the PIA, the Compact, or any Supplemental Agreement (PIA 3.5(b)(ii))

4c. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. Activities to be funded with MCC Funding being requested by such Disbursement Request will not violate any applicable law or regulation (PIA 3.5(b)(iii))

4d. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. The Implementation Plan Documents submitted to MCC are current and updated and are in form and substance satisfactory to MCC, and there has been satisfactory progress on the components of the Implementation Plan for any relevant Projects, Activities or sub-Activities related to such Disbursement (PIA 3.5(b)(iv))

4e. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. There has been satisfactory progress on the M&E Plan for the Program, any relevant Project, or any relevant Activity, and substantial compliance with the requirements of the M&E Plan (including the targets set forth therein and any applicable reporting requirements set forth therein for the relevant Disbursement Period) (PIA 3.5(b)(v))

4f. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. There has been no material negative finding in any financial audit report delivered in accordance with the Compact and Audit Plan, for the prior two quarters (or such other period as the Audit Plan may require) (PIA 3.5(b)(vi))

4g. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. Any Taxes paid with MCC Funding through the date ninety (90) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period have been reimbursed by the Government in full in accordance with Section 2.8 of the Compact (PIA 3.5(b)(vii))

4h. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. Any payment obligation of the Government arising through the date thirty (30) days prior to the start of the applicable Disbursement Period has been paid in full (or otherwise satisfied) by the Government, including, without limitation, any insurance, indemnification, tax payments, or other obligations, and the Government has contributed all resources required from it, under the Compact, the PIA, and any Supplemental Agreement (PIA 3.5(b)(viii))

4i. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. MCC does not have grounds for concluding that any matter certified to it in the related MCA Disbursement Certificate, Procurement Agent Disbursement Certificate, or Fiscal Agent Disbursement Certificate (or the equivalent documents delivered in connection with the initial Disbursement of Program Funding) is not as certified

4j. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. No act, omission, condition, or event has occurred that would be the basis for MCC to suspend or terminate, in whole or in part, MCC Funding in accordance with Section 5.1 of the Compact

4k. MCA-Moldova has satisfied each of the conditions precedent set forth in Section 3.5(b) of the PIA. Each of the Officers remains engaged, or if a position is vacant, MCA-Moldova is actively engaged, to MCC?s satisfaction, in recruiting a replacement (PIA 3.5(b)(i))

5a. MCA-Moldova will prior to the second Disbursement of MCC Funding, develop a comprehensive Social and Gender Integration Plan which, at a minimum, identifies approaches for regular, meaningful and inclusive consultations with women and other vulnerable/underrepresented groups, consolidates the findings and recommendations of Project-specific social and gender analyses and sets forth strategies for incorporating findings of the social and gender analyses into final Project designs as appropriate (PIA 2.6(a))
5b. MCA-Moldova will on an annual basis, review and update the Social and Gender Integration Plan as needed to reflect lessons learned and project-specific analysis. (PIA 2.6(c))
